Class ProbabilityCalculations

java.lang.Object
ProbabilityCalculations
public class ProbabilityCalculations extends Object
The ProbabilityCalculations class holds methods that calculate the probability of an event using various theorems and rules.
Author:
Rachel Hussmann

      public ProbabilityCalculations()

  • Method Details

    • conditionalProbability

      public double conditionalProbability(double probAandB, double probB)
      The conditionalProbability method finds the probability of A given B.
      Parameters:
      probAandB - The probability of A and B occurring at the same time.
      probB - The probability of B.
      Returns:
      The probability of A given B.

    • independence

      public boolean independence(double probA, double probB, double probAandB)
      The independence method checks to see if the two events are independent.
      Parameters:
      probA - The probability of event A.
      probB - The probability of event B.
      probAandB - The probability of event A and B occurring at the same time.
      Returns:
      True - if the two events are independent, false - if the events are dependent

    • independenceUsingAGivenB

      public boolean independenceUsingAGivenB(double probAgivenB, double probA)
      The independenceUsingAGivenB method checks to see if the two events are independent using the probability of A given B and the probability of A.
      Parameters:
      probAgivenB - The probability of event A given B.
      probA - The probability of event A.
      Returns:
      True - if the two events are independent, false - if the events are dependent

    • independenceUsingBGivenA

      public boolean independenceUsingBGivenA(double probBgivenA, double probB)
      The independenceUsingBGivenA method checks to see if the two events are independent using the probability of B given A and the probability of B.
      Parameters:
      probBgivenA - The probability of B given A
      probB - The probability of B
      Returns:
      true - if the two events are independent, false - if the events are dependent

    • mnRule

      public int mnRule(ArrayList<Integer> listOfNumbers)
      The mnRule method finds the total number of simple events given a set of numbers.
      Parameters:
      listOfNumbers - The list of numbers to be multiplied.
      Returns:
      The total number of simple events.

    • multinomialCoefficient

      public int multinomialCoefficient(int n, ArrayList<Integer> listOfSets)
      The multinomialCoefficient method finds the number of possible groups of objects into multiple different groups.
      Parameters:
      n - The number of objects.
      listOfSets - The list of groups.
      Returns:
      The number of groups that can be made.

    • multinomialCoefficient

      public BigInteger multinomialCoefficient(BigInteger n, ArrayList<BigInteger> listOfSets)
      The multinomialCoefficient method finds the number of possible groups of objects into multiple different groups.
      Parameters:
      n - The number of objects.
      listOfSets - The list of groups.
      Returns:
      The number of groups that can be made.

    • multiplicativeProbability

      public double multiplicativeProbability(double probA, double probB, double probAgivenB)
      The multiplicativeProbability method finds the probability of A and B, depending on if they are independent or not.
      Parameters:
      probA - The probability of event A.
      probB - The probability of event B.
      probAgivenB - The probability of event A given B.
      Returns:
      The probability of A and B

    • additiveProbability

      public double additiveProbability(double probA, double probB, double probAandB)
      The additiveProbability method finds the probability of A or B, depending on if they are independent or not.
      Parameters:
      probA - The probability of event A.
      probB - The probability of event B.
      probAandB - The probability of A and B.
      Returns:
      The probability of A or B.

    • findingAUsingAInverse

      public double findingAUsingAInverse(double probAInverse)
      The findingAUsingAInverse method finds the probability of A using the probability of A inverse.
      Parameters:
      probAInverse - The probability of A inverse.
      Returns:
      The probability of A

    • lawOfTotalProbability

      public double lawOfTotalProbability(ArrayList<Double> AgivenBi, ArrayList<Double> Bi)
      The lawOfTotalProbability method accepts ArrayLists and calculates the probability of A happening across a range of different other events.
      Parameters:
      AgivenBi - An ArrayList holding all the probabilities of A given Bi, where i is another event.
      Bi - An ArrayList holding all the probabilities of Bi.
      Returns:
      The probability of A

    • bayesRule

      public double bayesRule(ArrayList<Double> AgivenBi, ArrayList<Double> Bi, double AgivenBj, double Bj)
      The bayesRule method accepts ArrayLists and probabilities, and calculates the probability of A happening when we only know information about events B1, B2, . . .Bi.
      Parameters:
      AgivenBi - An ArrayList holding all the probabilities of A given Bi, where i is another event.
      Bi - An ArrayList holding all the probabilities of Bi.
      AgivenBj - The probability of A happening given a specific event, Bj, happening.
      Bj - The probability of a specific event, Bj, happening.
      Returns:
      The probability of a specific event, Bj, given A happens.

    • testerOutput

      public void testerOutput()
      The testerOutput method is used to test the methods that have been developed in this class.
